alert.note: Alert for Cleveland; Garvin; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 09 at 5:00AM CDT until July 09 at 6:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Garvin County in southern Oklahoma... Southwestern Seminole County in east central Oklahoma... Southeastern Cleveland County in central Oklahoma... Northwestern Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Northeastern Murray County in southern Oklahoma... Southwestern Pottawatomie County in central Oklahoma... Southeastern McClain County in central Oklahoma... * Until 600 AM CDT. * At 500 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Tribbey to near Foster, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Pauls Valley, Purcell, Sulphur, Davis, Slaughterville, Wynnewood, Lexington, Stratford, Konawa, Maysville, Maud, Roff, Elmore City, Wayne, Paoli, Bowlegs, Asher, Tribbey, Wanette, and Katie. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Cleveland; Garvin; McClain; Murray; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
